description:
I was stuck at the CPMC Davies campus  hospital in San Francisco while my wife recovered from surgery. 

I placed a delivery order of  chicken fettachini with some garlic bread.

My order came within 30 minutes. The portion size was very generous and the taste fantastic. 

They were also very helpful and nice to talk with while placing my order over the phone.

I would highly recommend them.

Don from Santa Rosa.
author: Don M.

description: The food (pasta dishes) weren't spectacular. A little over spicy. I enjoyed the ravioli but my boyfriend was not as impressed with his pasta with meatballs. Would have gotten a higher rating but the delivery was almost an hour later than estimated and 25 minutes longer than they said when I called to check. So, mediocre food plus super late delivery (which made the food cold) kinda makes this a no go for me.
author: Andy W.

description:
When I'm having those cravings and want some pizza delivered, these folks are always very nice on the phone, along with their delivery service being on good time. 

The cheese pizza is pretty solid. The sauce is tasty and tangy, the cheese is yummy. It gets the job done.

I also got a slice of New York cheesecake, (not pictured). It's a pretty decent slice.
author: Shruti D.

description: I always get the pizza from here and bring it to Dolores park. The pasta is delicious too.
author: Natthawan P.

description: Delicious pizza. 1-2 topping slices priced really well considering the size (my one slice was actually cut into 1.5 slices and both were still huge).
author: David W.

description: Rats . I seen I huge rat in here last night. I respectfully went you to the worker. And she acted as if she didn't understand what I was saying. Yes never eating here again. Still can't believe I saw a fat ass rat .
author: Alex L.

description: They are really nice folks! I got a cheese calzone and it was a very filling size and the outside was crunchy and the inside had a generous amount of ricotta cheese in it. The chef/owner is from Burma and so he also has Burmese food on the menu too. I tried his coconut soup and it had purple onions and cilantro and coconut milk and chicken and crunchy chips and it was sour and milky and so good! It is in an awesome location, right by the park so you can have a picnic there. Highly recommend this place!!
author: Emma S.

description: Dropped by here just as we were walking by. Got one pepperoni slice and it took about 15 to 20 minutes.  For one slice. Might as well order a whole pizza if I was gonna wait that long for one slice.
author: Bernard P.

description: Hey so I ordered their largest pizza, salad, 2 liter soda, wings and 3 cheesecakes. The food wasnt all that warm but I was okay with that, trying to be understanding that it was 4th of July. What I didn't appreciate was that I only received 1 cheesecake and when I called the next day to mention it, the person that answered did not resolve this. She told me there was no managers at the moment so she took my name and number. It's been exactly a week today and I'm still waiting for a call back.
author: Karolan M.

description: Tasty slice in a modest space.  A bit more spendy than I expected for a "slice", but each slice is more like a pie, made to order, and good size....and in the SHAPE of a slice.  I don't know if that is the typical program, but based on the options/selection of slices.....I guess I wouldn't be surprised.  But, as William Shakespeare famously penned: " ....a slice of hot, fresh pizza, by any other name, would still taste freaking delicious."
author: Mac S.

description: I love this place! You can go in and get slices or if you order a pizza it's a great price and tastes amazing! I live a few blocks down the street so when I order delivery it always arrives really fresh and fast so I might be biased lol :) nevertheless this pizza is better than many other local spots so I go out of my way to order from them.
author: Francesca D.

description: Under new ownership I was underwhelmed by my pizza. It was lacking in the clams I ordered for my topping. Compared to the previous owners this was very disappointing!
author: Patrick P.

description: Golden. Had a blast. Pizza was ready in 37 minutes. If you don't go here, are you even?
author: Andrew D.

description: I'm back again for lunch and I just totally spied on the worker making my calzone and he put sooo much effort and care into it! Pieces of cheese and mushrooms were falling off because it was so jam packed and he took the extra seconds to put every single piece back in! He stuffed the calzone to the brim, and then made it look super presentable too. Such an awesome place!
author: Christine P.

description: Me and my boyfriend really wanted something to eat late. Found this place, which closes at a decent time! We both ordered pasta (which the manager made herself!) it was really good! And the food came out fast! Very good service and super friendly! I would definitely come back again. Would love to try the pizza next!
author: Mia D.

description:
This is a very unique pizza slice restaurant because they actually cook each slice (actually double slice) fresh when you order it.  Its not pre-cooked and then reheated.  The price is very good for SF and the choices are endless.  I have just eaten the cheese pizza (I am cheap - its only $4.95 for a double slice).  Its not really NY style although it is normal, thin crust.  I would say it tastes like a better version of a Costco pizza with higher quality ingredients and not so bready.  It's close to NY.  The crust/dough is quite good and like I said fresh - better than re-heated, somewhat overcooked like some of the known slice places.  I never understand why those places fully cook the pizza since they are going to reheat it when someone orders.

It seems they may have problems with delivery - so perhaps you just need to be careful.  The couple is originally from Burma and have been in the US for 10 years.  Their customer service can be curt at times - but that is just their culture and probably still not being adroit at dealing with different type of americans.  Hours are good.  Pizza is good price - although they have some expensive versions with everything but the kitchen sink toppings.
author: Michael U.

description: I ordered the chicken and gnocchi and it arrived without sauce and the chicken isn't cooked all the way. I wouldn't expect to be able to eat this without getting sick
author: Jessica N.

description: It took me years to find it and seconds to define it, but Deja Vu's Franciscan pizza is the best pizza in San Francisco.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Deja Vu Pizza has a very special place in my heart. It was the first food item I ordered when I moved into my first San Francisco apartment (which is right across the street!).

I ordered a slice of the Tokyo Stop - a pizza topped with chicken teriyaki, mushrooms, and green onions. When my order was ready I thought they undercharged me, I saw two giant slices of pizza on the plate when I ordered one. To my surprise, that WAS the order - Deja Vu Pizza slices are just HELLA big. 

Definitely visit this family-owned Mission establishment if you have the chance and enjoy a slice of Tokyo Stop!
author: John L.

description: Ordered delivery through EAT24. The food was over an hour late. Restaurant was unresponsive by phone when calling to check on the order. Even a full refund from EAT 24 and a $25 credit wasn't enough to make up for this horrendously bad delivery experience. Never ordering from them again.
author: Carey B.

description: Stopped here before going to Dolores. The vibe of the place is a little off, but the workers are very nice. Their slices are HUUUGE, and mine was cooked fresh. The pizza is good, and the slices are the biggest I've ever seen. I ended up burning the shit out of my tongue because of my lack of self control. Let it cool off if they cook it fresh, lol.
author: Courtney A.

description: Deja Vu Pizza has a very special place in San Fransisco. This is my favorite pizza restaurant. The quality of the ingredients are very good. Bake Buffalo chicken is the best one ever. Highly recommend!!! The best place ever in San Fransisco.
author: Nadi W.

description: I tried to like this place, pizza isn't that bad. But service is the worst and makes the food not worth it. I rarely write reviews. and this is how unprofessional they were, I had to warn all you.
author: Julian R.

description:
the delivery was good, the food was ok, but i felt cheated because i paid extra for garlic and i only got one single raw garlic clove in my whole calzone even though i wrote in the note "roasted garlic" .
Yes, I also clicked on the add-on garlic item, so I was charged for that. Even though when the food was ok, it was not ok when i bit the raw garlic. 

To be honest, i think they did it on purpose because i put a note for them, for specifications. If when you mark "garlic" you get only one clove, the restaurant is cheating the customer. If the employees forgot my extra topping, i get it. But why to put only one raw clove?, especially after wrote in the notes spot the words "roasted garlic"? 
Very mean and dissapointing.
author: Janet V.

description:
I finally had a chance to try Deja Vu during one of my lunches. I'd heard that Deja Vu is great for slice spot as each slice is made to order and one slice should have no problem filling you up for lunch. I called ahead and by the time I got there (10 minutes) my order was ready to go. I handed over my credit card and signed away $5.11 after taxes. The lady behind the counter handed over a paper plate inside of a brown bag that had some weight to it.

Once I got back to the office, it was clear I got the odd slice (see pic), it had crust on 3 sides and it wasn't the best impression of a possible new lunch spot. It was almost as if the pizza was a left over Sicilian slice and someone had bitten off a piece. Luckily I love crust, so I wasn't terribly offended and I will admit the pizza had some good flavor but for the most part it felt pretty average across the board. 

Will I return? I probably will. My co-workers order often and split pies, so I hope to give it another try and perhaps get treated to a real slice. As for the pizzeria itself, the storefront is large enough that it has a few tables for those dining in but it seems this is more of a delivery or take out pizza shop.

Pros:
+ Slices made to order and ready within minutes
+ 1 topping slices run $4.50 plus tax 
+ Full speciality pies, calzones and past dishes also available
+ Dine in, delivery or take out

Cons:
- Sicilian slices are possible
- No parmesan cheese or red pepper packets to go
author: Alexander E.

description: Decent pizza but wings tend to stick to the bottom of the takeout container. Otherwise it is a pretty good joint and I'll be back :)
author: Luke E.

description: This is the best pizza that I have tasted in my three years in SF. The crust was crisp and flaky, and amazingly flavorful. This is how pizza should taste. The toppings were perfect.
author: Garric S.

description: I've loved their pizza for the size and how rich they are. The wait can be a bit long if you order it on site, so I'd recommend calling in, and then pick it up :) Quite the steal of $ for how expensive is everything else in this area.
author: Sofia C.

description: Very fast (faster than I expected) delivery by courteous friendly driver.    My order was 100% correct.  The calzone was huge and delicious.  I will order again!
author: Kevin A.

description: I ordered pizza for my students an hour before I needed it, they said it would be here at the time I needed it. They didn't show up, my students have 35 minutes for lunch and would like to enjoy their food. I called them back because after the hour the pizza was not here. They said it would be here in 10 minutes, that passed and nothing, called again and 15 minutes later it came. At this point my kids had 5 minutes to eat. Do NOT say you will deliver at a certain time if you will NOT!!! I want to give them no stars but the pizza is decent.
author: Leslie D.

description: Best slices around, hands down!!! They make them fresh from scratch to-order, even the crust! You won't find cold pre-made slices here. No way, they make each slice to-order fresh! And they're huuuuge! Each slice is actually two slices. It takes a bit longer than your average slice place but it's so worth it. Delish!
author: A L.

description:
Sat 1130pm De Ja Vu Pizza 
16th St San Francisco Ca.

Service gets a 10 of 10.  I live 2 blocks away so the delivery was short but it took under 20 minuted from order to delivery.  The delivery guy was polite, friendly and cute.  Nice smile:)

The food was 9 of 10.  They still call their chocolate moose "chocolate cake".  Very good but moose is much richer than just chocolate cake. Something to keep in mind when you order their "chocolate cake"  The 2 liter of soda was cold as expected.  The pizza was good but a different taste than some.  Not much dessert selection but still a 9 of 10.  

I would order from them again because the delivery was very quick and the food was ok.
No real disapointments.  

The place is a mom & pop staple that has been there for years so they must be doing something right. Did I mention the delivery guy was cute?
author: John D.

description:
I ordered a calzone along with spaghetti with marinara sauce. salad was included as a side. Usually I would check and make sure I have all my food but the guy abruptly left. So when I opened my food I saw that their was no salad. I am very dissapointed because it did ruin my meal and the guy left without making sure I had received everything. Had I gotten my salad this would've been a 4 star review. 

As for the food the spaghetti with marinara sauce was good while the calzone was not very good but that couldve been forgiven had you not forgotten my salad. 

I may or may not order from here again but this really put a bad taste in my mouth.
author: Mohammad A.

description: The food was cold and disgusting, took an hour and a half (45 minutes longer than quoted) at 9pm on a Monday, and they forgot my salad. I'd sooner order from pizza-hut.
author: Cortney H.

description: We got it for delivery so maybe it would've been better piping hot. It was ok but not great. Crust was too thick in my opinion.
author: Monica R.

description: The best slice of pizza I have ever had!! Each slice is made individually. So yummy!
author: Jessica C.

description: My favorite whole in the wall pizza place! I only recommend to go there for pizza other items are just okay.
author: Iveth R.

description: Service is pretty hit or miss, but they cook slices to order. Slices, which I'd like to add, are massive and delicious.
author: Jade M.

description:
The pizza crust it's to thin, chicken wings need more time in the oven, delivery took 1 hour, no cheese or crush pepper, order a cesar salad and got a lettuce with American and chedar chesse a slice of tomato and a little side of ranch, no fork.
Not a good pizza delivery.
author: Margarita L.

description:
Great local pizza and pasta place. They are open late til 11:30. 

Pizza - HUGE. You can order a whole pizza or by the slice. A slice is really two huge slices so it seems like it's a bit more expensive when you're looking at the menu but it's really a great deal for how much pizza you get. All of their pizzas are delicious. My favorite is the San Franciscan.

Pasta + apps - these are delicious too. All of their pastas are delicious and come with a side salad or garlic bread. Their meatballs (spaghetti and meatballs or they have a meatball appetizer that is just meatballs with sauce) are amazing. Their wings are good too, but it's hard to compete with Giordano's across the street (best buffalo wings ever). 

Salads - this is also my go to spot in the neighborhood for a salad. All of their salads are delicious and big and have very fresh ingredients. They give you a good amount of proteins and you can choose your dressing. 

Overall, it's a great neighborhood spot. The service is wonderful and very efficient. They also deliver. They have one tv and a small sitting area if you want to eat in the restaurant, but it's super casual so I usually get things to go.
author: Juliet S.

description: Great pizza for the price.  I always order a slice of San Franciscan.  It's the best deal if you like combo.  Easy and fast for pickup since I live right there
author: Bradley W.

description: Got a calzone. It was kinda funky looking and lopsided. Some parts were too doughy. It was edible, but it was kind of awkward to eat this messy calzone. I got the cheese calzone with sausage and tomato. It was $8.10.
author: Denise C.

description: Pizza was delicious, the bbq calzone wasn't so great but I was hungry so I ate it. The buffalo chicken.......simply don't order it. It's mushy and gross.
author: Michael J.

description: Perfect crust and a great variety of toppings. American bacon, green olives and fresh tomatoes = perfection.
author: Laura W.

description: Horrible place do not order from here I wanted a fettuccini Alfredo and the chicken was grey uncooked andit smelt like fish as if it was rotten got sick the second I tried it
author: Bianca C.

description: Delicious pizza! I always come here for a slice of pizza and the slice is so big it could count as 2! Convenient location too.
author: David P.

description: They were going to sent me away without my full order until opened the bag.  Got home and found they gave me the wrong salad.  They didn't give me the correct salad when I went back and apologized for the error.  The price didn't match the service.  I will give them another chance.
author: Crazy Food J.

description: Disappointed. Ordered a meat lovers pizza, wasn't awful but wasn't great either. Good amount of toppings but not much flavor, especially not in the crust. Ordered wings, these were awful...very mushy and no flavor. We couldn't eat them so they were tossed. We also ordered two cheesecakes that came frozen so they were tossed as well. No utensils were packed, no condiments, and no napkins. The best part of our meal was the bottles of Mexican coke. Would not recommend at all.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Best pizza in the Mission, and some of the best pizza in San Francisco!  Great crust combines with just the right amount of cheese, sauce, and toppings so that no one part is to heavy, greasy, or overpowering.  Did I mention that they make even their slices by hand?  Oh yes they do!  They also deliver within the neighborhood in SF.  I love the pies from here and can't wait for the next time I get a slice!
I'll be back!
author: Jim P.

description:
I haven't bought a pizza from Deja Vu in a few years, not because I didn't like them but I was just not feeling pizza-y.  It's clear it's under new management.  Judging by the cut pattern, I suggest they get someone with pizza making experience to train the pizza makers.  

I ordered a large vegetarian supreme the other night, and it looked as if it had been topped from four feet away.  Perhaps they were playing, "Pizza Ring Toss" or trying to make two or more pizzas at the same time.  Some of veggies were somewhat evenly distributed, others less so.  The tomatoes heavily favored one side, and were cut too thickly.  The garlic was apparently flung on, splattering the pizza in large and small glops.  

An important point for ALL pizza joints:  Raw garlic needs to be placed on the pizza LAST, on top, so it can cook properly  and release its wonderful load of garlic flavor.  By putting it on the sauce first it gets warm, but does not cook fully, which defeats the point of the garlic.  We did not smell garlic when we opened the box and stuck our face in it, and we should have.

But we were able to redistribute the toppings, more or less, and it was tasty.  Crust and sauce were fine, not great.  It was not too expensive and also arrived quickly, so not a one-star experience.
author: Jasp R. G.

description:
Huge slices made to order, and open late.  What more do you need??

Well, how about the fact that it's right next to the heart of the Mission District, which means this is a great location next to a ton of bars and clubs, with their fresh hot slices waiting for you when you're done hopping for the day (or night).  

It's not super cheap but for the price you pay you get what you pay for.  HUGE slices, nice and crisp crust, lots of cheese and toppings, enough sauce for taste but not too much to overpower, and they come out piping hot on a nice flimsy paper plate.  Great for late night eating!

They also have a few desserts too.  Did someone say tiramisu!!?  :)
author: Robert K.

description: This is my favorite pizza restaurant in San Francisco. The quality of the ingredients is second to none. Highly recommend!
author: Brian M.

description:
Slices are huge
Price is cheap....
Their not cheap or stingy with their ingredients.
Ex: Hawaiian Pizza, I can pick off pineapple n still have a great amt on the slice
They use really fresh n pretty products
Custom made slices,cheaper than any other place in the city
Pizzas always take 15/20 min. to cook
When their swamped tho or closing and swamped, they try n cook the pizzas at a higher temperature which can produce crunchier pizza, yet never burnt. I love it here.
Ive taken friends there and so far everyone has loved it as well.
author: Mar L.

description: Our neighborhood pizza spot for years and years. Incredible food and familial staff that my boyfriend and I are absolutely in love with! Enormous, delicious slices that are stacked with toppings for days! The only place I'll get pizza in SF
author: Lily B.

description:
I love this place ! 
I order from them at least once a week. 
Food is always good. 
Deliver is always fast. 
Great job you guys.
author: Paul O.

description:
Have you ever been to a new place and swear you've been there before? Well, ironically, Deja Vu isn't one of those places for me. Nope, never been here. Ever. It's not really a pizza place, more like a pizza stand with three tables and a counter. It's on 16th, and it looks to be a neighborhood hangout because people come in very casually and pick up their gigantic slices and off they go. Jamie W. and I came here looking for an alternative to the Sausage Factory in the Castro. Creatures of habit that we are, it was hard to find something within proximity that fit the bill.

Deja Vu works in a pinch, but I wouldn't call it destination pizza for anybody outside of the Mission or the Castro. The cashier is very sweet, and there was nothing wrong withe the clientele. It just was regulation pizza with a whole lot of toppings. We went large and ordered the pricey $29.25 House Combo which was chock full of cheese, salami, ground beef, pepperoni (a must with Jamie), mushrooms, bell peppers, tomatoes, black olives, onions, and garlic (see photo). We secured the middle table and started demolishing it only to stop short at half the pie. Too many ingredients after all is said and done. Burp.

PIZZA - 3 stars...a solid pie with lots of stuff on it
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...well, not to be a total snob...
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...very quiet and kind
TOTAL - 3 stars...give one to the 'hood
author: Ed U.

description:
This place is truly awful. The staff are rude and have no sense of customer service. The spaghetti with meatballs was tasteless and as for my "spaghetti pesto" - I didn't even receive that as they messed up the order. Instead I got a plate of congealed cream and cheese with spaghetti. 

One star is overly generous for a truly awful place. Go here if your desperate or completely drunk you've lost all sense of taste.
author: Daniel H.

description: This place is horrible. I ordered pepperoni pizza and wings for delivery... hard to mess up right? WRONG. Wings came so soggy they were stuck to the bottom of the container (and they were tiny baby wings). Also, I can pretty much eat pizza from anywhere I'm not picky.... That being said it wasn't even appetizing. Cheese seemed old like it was a reheated pizza that had sat out all night. Definitely no cheese stringing when you grab your slice. Do not order from here and waste your money. I don't know who is giving this place good reviews because it's probably one of the worst I've had.
author: Kristin C.

description:
At its core, pizza is three items: cheese, sauce, and dough.  Most places in SF do a good job with the cheese and the sauce.  After all, we live in California, getting quality cheese isn't difficult.  And, good tomato sauce is pretty easy to find.  Even the finest pizzerias in NYC or New Jersey use tomato sauce made from tomatoes that were picked and packed in California's Central Valley. 

Where most joints fail - and where Déjà Vu EXCELS - is in their dough.  Déjà Vu's dough tastes like something you would want to eat, like fresh from the oven breadsticks, and not something you want to leave on your plate.  (You know how a lot of people leave the crust behind?  I've never been that kind of an eater - I'm definitely a founding member of the clean plate club - but I can't blame folks when it comes to most pizza slices in SF.  A lot of them have lousy dough that results in a crappy crust not worth eating.)

Good dough should have a certain chewiness, an inherent elasticity that comes from the gluten in the flour.  If your pizza crust is "powdery" and flavorless, it's just not the way it should be.  Arinell's makes dough like this - no "toothiness", no flavor, it's flat and lifeless.  MELTED CHEESE can cover a multitude of sins, but if your dough can't stand up on its own, you're eating sub-par pizza.  But, if you start with good dough, if your foundation has got its own flavor, you're way ahead of the pack, and Déjà Vu has definitely mastered the art of the dough. 

My absolute favorite topping here is their SAUSAGE.  It's hard to put it into words, which is unfortunate given that I'm supposed to be a writer, but, I'll try.  Not only does their sausage have great flavor and spiciness, but it's got the perfect texture.  Don't get me wrong, I like pepperoni, but if I have a choice between circular sliced meat or meat that is crumbled and hasn't been put into a sausage casing, I'll take the ground meat variety every time.  I'd rather eat morsels of meat than slices of meat, and if you feel the same way, I would STRONGLY recommend your ordering the sausage at Déjà vu.  

What they define as a "slice" is more like 1.5 slices at a normal pizza parlor.  (Pizza parlor, right?  Who the hell says THAT anymore?  Man, you know I'm old skool.)  So, while $4.61 sounds like a lot for a slice with one topping, if you figure it's really like a slice and a half, suddenly, it's not so bad.

The other thing you need to know about them, especially if you are in a hurry - like on your lunch break - is that they make your slice to order.  I mean they LITERALLY create your slice from scratch, from the raw, stretchy dough.  Each SLICE (not pie, but SLICE) starts out as dough and is stretched and topped with sauce, cheese, and whatever you asked for as a topping AFTER YOU ORDER IT.  Which is COOL if you're down with freshness and customization, but is sort of uncool if you're on a tight schedule.  I mean, for me, pizza is typically one of those "I see it behind the glass display case, I want THAT slice right there, they heat it up and I'm eating it within 3 minutes" kind of deals.  But that is NOT how it works at Déjà Vu and you should know that going in.  Your personalized slice, made from scratch when you order it, is going to take 10-12 minutes to be made, and it's going to be MOTHERFUCKING HOT when it comes out of the oven.  

What is the solution?  PHONE AHEAD.  Yes, as crazy as it might seem (to anyone from NYC, Northern New Jersey or Connecticut) you can literally call them up and say, "I want to order a SLICE with sausage, and I'll come by and pick it up in 15 minutes."  That is really the best way to do it here.  That way, your slice has a chance to "settle" in a little bit before you bite into it.  It's still fresh from the oven, but it's not burn the roof of your mouth fresh from the oven, you know what I mean?  

In summary: Déjà Vu is not a spontaneous kind of thing.  It requires a little bit of planning, like, "We're on the Bay Bridge, we'll be driving past their shop in 15 minutes, let's call ahead and order two slices to pick up, whaddya say, honey?"  But it's worth the effort.  These guys are on my top 5 favorite pizza spots in SF.  Get the sausage.  Let me know what you think.  Reach out to me, I'm very easy to find:  www.FoodDudeSF.com or FoodDudeSF@gmail.com.  Happy eating!!
author: FoodDudeS F.

description: My brother didn't join the fam for our annual trek to Mission Dolores on an October Sunday for a Peruvian Catholic celebration. When I told him I would be taking my daughter to lunch in the Mission, he laughed and said "Enjoy that $20 hipster lunch." I argued that we'd stop in for a cheap slice of pizza a block from the church like we did last year so he best be quiet. But he was right! Our divey pizza spot has raised its prices. I spent over $20 for two slices(though each slice was double the traditional size and super delicious), a small salad, and bottled waters. I distinctly remember being short on cash last year and still getting a meal. And yes there were hipsters there.
author: Julie C.

description:
Tried to order something from here through eat24 online, said the order was confirmed, charged my card, then food never came and now I have to wait to contact the restaurant while it's open just to get a refund.

cool
author: Toni R.

description:
This place will always be my casual pizza hook up. Love getting the sausage and black olive pizza slice, with a Drizzle of hot sauce. I usually call in for pick up. Never experience the delivery service part because I live across the street from this place. The lady on the phone can sort of put you on hold for a couple of minutes, which you should hang up and call again. Overall this place is excellent. 

Btw (by the way) they don't serve gluten free pizza so all you hipsters can go suck a gluten free dick, but if you really are allergic to gluten then this is not the place for you.
author: Michael V.

description: Big slices of pizza, they have raised the prices but that goes for almost all businesses. The pizza is also very delicious would recommend coming to this place if you are in the are. They take about 10-15 min for a slice so also call ahead to make sure you don't have to wait that long. It's a small little place but worth stopping by and checking it out!
author: Vanessa D.

description: I actually think this is the best pizza in the SF. Been going here since I went to middle school. They have been open for quite some time. They make it the same exact way so theres never a nasty pizza.
author: Theresa H.

description: I have high respect for a place that will bake you a slice from scratch.. every time. As in, no stale slices of pizza sitting around to be reheated when you order. Fucking made to order personal slices of pizza that are HUGE. Just to add to the freshness of the whole thing, the crust is perfect - not too thin or thick, crispy on the bottom and chewy at the crust. Since its personally made for you, there is a crust around the whole damn thing. It usually takes around five to ten minutes to make, but hey if you want crappy fast food, go to McDonalds.
author: Henry W.

description: Delivery took longer than advertised, then the driver dropped the pizza on the porch, completely squashing it. Good pizza, shame about the disaster.
author: Scott L.

description: Honestly there's nothing wrong with pizza but I ordered a pepperoni and jalapeño. Instead I got a pineapple and jalapeño call and ask if they can fix it. But they just gave me the runaround. oh well
author: Eden G.

description: This is our reliable go to pizza spot for delivery. The ingredients are good quality, delivery time is usually between 45 min to an hour and the prices are great! There are also lots of veggies available for toppings  which is great for those nights when we want pizza, but no meat.
author: Lisa B.

description:
This review is for a delivery ordered off Eat24.

Absolutely the worst, worse service I have received in a very long time. I placed my order at 7:15PM and was quoted a 45 delivery timeframe. "Not bad" I thought, "have dinner by 8:10PM- 8:15PM at the latest and still have time to catch some friends for a drink."

8:30PM rolls around and I call the restaurant. The manager tells me that my delivery left over 10 minutes ago and my food should arrive at any second. No problem, only 15 minutes late. At 8:45PM, still no food. I call the restaurant again, and am told yet again, "Any minute now."

At 8:55PM, I call the restaurant for the final time- and tell them that at this point, they should cancel my order. The food had been ordered over two hours prior and was "on it's way" for over 45 minutes- which means it was sitting unheated, unrefrigerated in some teenagers car for close to an hour and was reaching unsanitary conditions. To this final complaint the manager responds that he "didn't actually call the driver the other times and didn't know the food hadn't left the restaurant yet so it was still sanitary." When I asked for a refund you could almost hear the shrug on the phone as he responded "you already paid for it."

Way to go buddy, your lack of service constituted a Yelp review.
author: Jasmine r.

description:
Pretty good pizza, but nothing amazing. My biggest critique would be that the pizza needs more sauce, but it just depends on your preference I suppose. In my personal opinion the sauce is the most important part!

I'd probably give it another shot to see if Deja Vu could make me a fan, but I would probably prefer trying out the other options in the area. Until then, I feel like this place is just any other average pizza joint.
author: Sally T.

description: Super friendly... Even pizza by the slice is cooked to order 100℅ FRESH! family owned & run. This was my first time but I'll be here at least once a week! Price range for pizza by the slice us $$$(9.00 for a slice of veggie) 190℅ worth it! I would pay $12!
author: Rob D.

description:
Affordable, hearty big "slices" the size of a personal pizza that are made to order in 10 min or less. The Pesto Delight is good when I'm in the mood for something fancy, the Margherita for something simpler. 

The interior is nothing to write home about, but the late hours, quick service, and value for your money can't be beat.
author: Cat C.

description: This place is so fucking good. Tons of options. Slices are easily customizable. Price is on point. Slices are the prefect size for one person. Definitely one of my favorites in the Mission Delores area.
author: Daniel T.

description:
Pizza slices excellent and fresh cause made to order, HUGE, and have an unusual shape.  There's something just a tiny bit different about their sauce in a good way. 

As others have mentioned, their dough is outstanding. The guy who makes the pizza massages each one. It's soft with just the right crispness.
author: Becca D.

description:
We've ordered from here before and it was always decent. (Hard to find a good pizza round here). 
But tonight was the last time. The teriyaki chicken pizza was unedible. The chicken was grainy and made the pizza sooo wet, and the kicker... I found a hair on the bottom of the crust, short black hair. Ughhh...
author: Kelly H.

description: Pizza is decent, but nothing remarkable. I asked for the pizza to be well done and it was undercooked. However, the delivery is lightening fast. I'll order again for my hungry crowd just because of this.
author: Andrea C.

description: From their excellently crafted calzones, to simple slices of pizza, this place is an absolute sin to pass up! With their minimalist atmosphere Deja Vu can be quite easy to miss, but don't be fooled by their all-too-simple dining room. What they lack in decor they make up for in power-packed, unforgettable authentic flavor. Come prepared to take home leftovers because the meals are very well portioned! But I warn you, if you lack self-control when it comes to good food you might not be able to stop eating! Completely Satisfied.
author: Y. C.

description: Best drunk pizza I have ever had. I was extremely surprised that they made a single slice from scratch, it wasn't reheated old pizza that they had sitting around. Very nice staff and quite place at least around midnight.
author: Luis O.

description:
Great deal on the lunch special, delicious pizza. I love that you can customize your slice with any sort of topping since it's made to order.

IMO it's within the top 3 slices in SF. Also try Arinell for an even cheaper slice and the always delicious Escape From New York.
author: Matt C.

description:
Seeing my beloved Arinell Pizza closed early last night after running out of pizza, I walked around 16th St and found Deja Vu. At first, I was thinking about getting a slice. Yes, the $6-7 slice prices stunned me (and yet I bet they are worth it as you'll see), so I spent the extra $2 for a calzone...the Ashbury calzone!

Ashbury: pesto, chicken, tomatoes, green peppers. And calzone crust that was amazing!

It's all made fresh on the spot, even the slices, and I'd rather wait an extra few minutes than get a slice made hours ago resting in a hot box.

The Ashbury was a winner as I almost licked the plate. I mean hey, it was about 9:30 at night when I went, so nobody would've seen me lick it except the random hipster walking by. I'm coming back to get a whole pie with Ashbury.
author: Josh O.

description:
I'm so in love with you Deja vu!!! Burmese pizza man CAN make yummy pizza!! Oops I mean calzone. The pizza is bland. The calzones I can recommend!! I got the 4 cheese California calzone and yes it was missing veggies, but I had a salad on the side (not from Deja vu). 
Besides the fact that these guys are freakin' ninja delivery drivers and get here in no time is the amazingly tasty and pleasantly textured crust!! It's so good! Also, they don't hold back on the oregano and that flavor just hits the SPOT for a pizza crave. All that and a diet coke for 9 bucks. I have also tried a cheese calzone with mushrooms, sausage, and garlic, ricotta, red sauce and mozz. Yummm!
author: Libra J.

description:
Can't say I love the pizza, but I did eat the whole honkin' huge thing, so a-ok by default?

I got the slice with tomato and bbq chicken. As other reviewers have said, they make your slice fresh for you, but the wait isn't so bad. Pizza slices are HUGE here and easily three times the amount of food you'd get at a standard pizzeria. Only problem was that the crust didn't have too much going for it and the toppings were sparse. Where's the bbqness to the chicken?
author: Kevin L.

description:
After a quick minute at Kilowatt (man I seriously love Kilowatt) HB Steph and I went in search of pizza. We went to Arinell but it was closed (sick of the drunk Mission kids, I get it.) And then we turned around and headed here. 

They play soft jazz as background music. Which would prevent any hipster fights that may occur, as its hard to be an ahole when there's soft jazz playing. (I'm sure someone will prove me wrong on this someday.)

Pizza was fine. Buttery crust. Better than the crap up my street. Its no Arinell or EFNY, but it did the trick.
author: Emily D.

description:
Some of the tastiest pizza I've had. Their deep dish is NOT Chicago style deep dish (which is more of a tomato based pie tbh) it's more of a deep pan in the classic style. I think some people don't expect that and get disappointed.

That said - it's DELICIOUS. The crust is one of the tastier I've had. Definitely my new go-to pizza place.

My only complaint (and the reason this is 4 stars) is that they are a little bit pricy. Not terrible, but not cheap enough on balance to quite get that 5 star rating.
author: Gregory W.

description: Quite good and always hot when it arrives!  The sausage is quite nice.  It's not NY style or the best pizza I've eaten, so I deducted a point.  Solid though and definitely good for delivery.
author: Mark B.

description: This is my favorite place to get pizza in the city. The portions are ginormous and the crust is just the right thickness and cooked perfectly. It's a small shop, and everyone's always really friendly to me. I really dig the pesto, but regular sauce is also tasty. I love Déjà vu pizza!
author: Roxanne H.

description:
Simple, efficient, quick. Pizza when you need it. Calzone when your too lazy to walk 2 blocks. Great neighborhood pizza place.

Best pizza - bbq chicken
author: Space T.

description:
I dream of this pizza since the day my friend who once lived above it, introduced us. It was love at first, gigantic slice. In LA there is pizza but this is PEEET-ZAH! I love being able to order what I want by the slice and almost no pizza place does that. I'm glad that when I come home, I can come here to get my fix.

Until we meet again, Deja Vu...
author: Marina V.

description:
Tried Déjà vu pizza , with my boyfriend on New Year's Eve and we received the delivery in an hour which was amazing ! We ordered the San Franciscan , which was really delicious and their ingredients are really fresh ! 

The only suggestion that I have is that they work on their customer service when they are taking orders , they came across as rude . 

Other then that my boyfriend & I will definitely order from them again !
author: Milinda K.

description: I keep trying other places, and I just come back to Deja Vu. They don't skimp on the toppings, everything tastes fresh, good customer service, and delivery is always under an hour. Look no further and just order already!
author: JJ F.

description:
We live in the area so we were frequent, loyal and fatty customers. However, due to our most recent experience we've decided it's time to find another greasy pizza joint that does late night deliveries. 

See, we're not exactly food snobs (in case that wasn't obvious) and we can overlook several crap deliveries that involve missing items, wrong orders, rude employees, etc. because like I said, we're fat and hungry at 12 am and will pretty much put up with anything. This time we were totally screwed over and it was just wrong, man, wrong! If you want to know why the name of this restaurant is called Deja Vu, it's because every time they deliver a pizza it feels like you're experiencing the same crappy service over and over again. The pizza itself really isn't that bad - though it's not great either - but their service totally sucks!

This is how things went down. We ordered a large pizza. As my housemate grabbed the box, the driver placed the soda on top and the weight flipped the box over and onto the ground. The pizza was a dirty sloppy mess afterward but it had been paid for so the driver told us to call the restaurant and explain what happened so we could get a replacement. They basically told us we'd have to buy another pizza if we wanted a pizza! No apology, no offer of a discount or coupon, nothing. They even made us feel bad for expecting some type of consolation by informing us that the new pizza would come out of the delivery driver's pay if we didn't pay for it.

So my housemate paid for another pizza. What? We were hungry! The genius driver is back and not only does he complain about us telling the manager what happened, he tries to make my housemate feel like an asshole because he got chewed out by the manager. My housemate, who is usually a really patient understanding guy told him, "Good. You deserved it!" After all that, we kind of lost our appetites but we ate it anyway because it did cost us over $40. Also, did I mention that we are fat? Okay, not really fat but we do like to eat.
author: Elaine B.

description: Really good place to have some decent pizza at a good price. They're cheaper than other places in the area and taste just as good. Fast delivery and nice delivery driver too. I've never been to the shop just had delivery so i don't know what it's like inside. All I know is you get what you pay for and its good.
author: Krishna V.

description: My coworker and I had heard good things about this place but my experience wasn't great. We placed an order for our food; I ordered a pizza slice and a pasta to go. My coworker had ordered a green salad to have before her pasta. We sat there for 30mins after placing our order and we were ignored. Nothing was coming our way. The only food that came on time were our drinks and that's because you get them out of the fridge yourself. My coworker asked where her salad was and the lady said, very soon, as she then started to make it. There was one man in the bake making pizza and one woman in the front taking orders and cooking apparently. No one else was in the restaurant. 5 mins later my coworker asked if that was my pizza sitting back there, and it was. So I ate my pizza slice while my coworker had her salad which basically only consisted of iceberg lettuce. I had the Pesto Delight which was really yummy. We proceeded to wait there an additional 15mins without our pastas.During these past 15mins, a woman walks in and starts having a friendly conversation with the woman working upfront. My coworker then asked for our pastas to be put in to go containers since we had been waiting there for so long. The woman said, ok sure and then barely STARTED to cook the pasta. It was ridiculous! We asked her, "so you haven't even began cooking it?" And the lady just smiled. At this point I don't even know how much time had passed because we were so aggravated. I'm assuming it was about 15 mins later she told us to come get it from the counter. Only to find out she had cooked me the wrong pasta. I'm a Pescatarian which I had informed her of when I placed the order. She then asks me, "you don't like chicken?" And I had to explain to her yet again that I had ordered prawns. I asked for a refund because I was already late going back to work. She refused and said she'll just cook me another one. I was so irritated. Why won't you give me my money back? I had to wait there until she was done. I will say she cooked it pretty fast. But now I'm just irritated for paying for over priced food and poor customer service. She could have at least offered a free soda or something but she herself seemed annoyed. Now I have a cold container of pasta that I don't even really know if it tastes good because I had to wait over an hour to get it. Don't go here if you only have an hour lunch break.
author: Eliza B.

description: This place sells pizza "by the slice", which is cool. Except for some unknown reasons, they also make the pizza "by the slice". Which is weird on its own, but then name the place "Deja Vu", like in what life time have I ever walked into a place that sells pizza, made "by the slice". Not to mention the slices aren't slice shaped. The entire experience undermines that the pizza isn't that bad. It's confusing and painful.
author: Avi O.

description: I've been eating here loyally for 4 years but today I was in there eating and two mice were roaming around in broad daylight. I confronted the owners about it and they were aware of the problem. This is a definite code violation and they should be shut down until this problem is totally eradicated. I really loved their pizza and the owners are cool but I was totally grossed out and I will never come again whether the problem is fixed or not.
author: Rodney H.

description: Bad food waited 1 hour 45 mins!!! Wrong order no bell pepper guess what tons! Allergic....Wanted sausage & pepperoni none!!! Bland price to much, never again
author: Virginia S.

description: Im two weeks new in town & just order this delivery, it is The Best food I have eaten in San Francisco ! Very Hot and Fresh made with Love
author: Chara E.

description:
DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY!!

I placed my order at 10:00pm. All we ordered was two Cesar salads, garlic bread, and a slice of cheesecake, so not a complicated or labor intensive order at all. Delivery estimate was given at 60 minutes. After waiting an hour and fifteen minutes without receiving my food, I called the restaurant and  was told the delivery driver had just left and my food would arrive soon (I live ten minutes away from this restaurant). Forty five minutes later, my food had still not arrived. I called the restaurant again, and was told the exact same thing. 

Finally, after OVER TWO HOURS of waiting, my food arrived. At this point, it was past midnight on a weeknight. To add insult to injury, the garlic bread was burnt and cold. The Cesar salads were mediocre at best, and the extremely small slice of cheesecake was average.

I can't believe this place has four stars. If it's going to take two hours to receive some salads, delivery service shouldn't even be offered. The wait was ridiculous and the food was average at best. I will not be ordering again.
author: Amy K.

description:
Worst service ever.  When I walked in I was the only person in the restaurant.  After I ordered, the place filled up.  

I waited for my order ... and waited ... and waited.  About half an hour went by, everyone else got their order except me.  I asked the "manager" what was up and she just said "I don't know, it's coming."  

Another ten minutes goes by and I ask again, starting to get really pissed off now. It turns out my order had been sitting there on top of the oven the whole time, and nobody cared or noticed.

The pizza was cold, so I asked for my money back, but they didn't want to give it to me.  I actually had to argue to get a refund for cold pizza.  Unbelievable.  Not even an apology from these jerks.

Wow.  Never.  Ever.  Again.
author: Matthew M.

description:
As far as Pizza goes in San Francisco's Mission District, Deja Vu is a tasty find. A good friend of mine took me to this place one evening. I don't do a lot of crazy things when it came to Pizza. I looked at the fact that it was by the slice and said to my friend "I think I'll order two" to which his reply was, "I think you'll only need one." Trusting his advice, I ordered the Margarita Pizza. The size was definitely enough for 1 hungry person and a bit too much for a smaller person like my wife. I was very satisfied with the pizza, from taste, portion size and price point perspective. 

I've gone back to Deja Vu numerous times since and everyone I've introduced it to has enjoyed the pizza.
author: Rich T.

description: this is my childhood pizzeria, til this day i got there to eat pizza.  Someting about the pizza makes it so tastefl.One slice of pizza is enough too always make me full.  The prices for a slice is soooo cheap, during lunch getting the lunch special is so worth it! a slice of pizza (technically is 2) a salad and a drink for $7!!!
author: Isabella R.

description:
why can they not give me parmesan and crushed red peppers?  i dont get it.  isn't that basically standard for a pizza place?  last time i got delivery form them, the guy didnt bring any.  he also said he didnt have any in the car.  really?  none??

so, this itme i asked for it specifically in my order.  they delivered the pizza.  i asked the delivery guy if there was parmesan and peppers and he said yes and pointed to the pizza box in my hands.  after he left, i open the box... no peppers and parm. it's deja vu. arggghh!!!!  i dont understand.. why is it so hard?!  and why would the delivery man flat out lie to my face?  that's some impressive customer service.  i think this will be my last time getting pizza from them.
author: vlad k.

description: We order out from these guys frequently, and the food is always fast and good. Perfect for a Friday night after a long week. The Cajun Fettuccine with Chicken is fantastic, and the pizzas are generally really good too.
author: Ryan P.

description:
A friend told me this place was excellent and told me you have to wait for them to cook the slices but it's worth the wait.  So I went tonight and it turns out he was right.  I got a pineapple slice for three something and it's more like 2 slices and delicious as hell.

amen!,  6 star$  ******
author: Cynthia B.

description:
See my five star review of Serrano's for the lowdown on the slices here. I hope this place stays awesome and doesn't pull the same crap that Serrano's did on me to bring it down to a 1.

Long live Deja Vu.
author: J S.

description:
I'm a vegetarian and ordered an item with pineapple. It came with meat. I called the restaurant and they said there was nothing they could do. 
They redirected me to eat24. They said there was nothing they could do.

Just wasted $17.
author: Lara R.

description:
After being told it would be a 90-minute wait at Starbelly (note to self: get reservations next time), the hubs and I walked down Church and a relatively circuitous 1.5 mile walk later we ended up here - the only restaurant with food we would both eat that wasn't completely packed at 9pm on a Friday night. Perhaps this should have been a bad sign? Nah.

We got a small pizza - pepperoni, salami, artichoke hearts, onions, black olives. Fifteen minutes or so later it arrived, and it was admittedly not too bad. This is no Pizzeria Delfina, mind you, but it is a perfectly serviceable American-style chewy crusted pizza. The girl at the counter was a total sweetheart, and the prices were pretty good - though not what I'd call cheap.

It's not something I'd particularly seek out again, but if I happened to be in the area, I'd go back.
author: Amanda P.

description:
The office smelled like pizza all afternoon for some reason so I was craving a good slice for dinner. I found just what I was looking for at Deja Vu.

First of all, the "slices" are HUGE. They come sliced down the middle, so they're really two slices a piece, and you still need a fork and a knife. I can eat a lot and I never have leftovers, but the two slices I ordered at Deja Vu were a challenge - which I won. One slice is probably enough for a normal person, split three among two of you if you're gluttons like me.

I ordered a slice of cheese and a slice of the restaurant's namesake, Deja Vu. The cheese slice was the same style as other down and dirty pizza by the slice joints, but better than most. Also on the greasier side, but not too bad. The Deja Vu slice was much more interesting. It contained spinach, feta, and pesto. They were all high quality ingredients and they worked together nicely.

This would definitely be an excellent place to come late at night when you've got the munchies, but you don't need to be drunk to come here.
author: Adam B.

description:
Adding an extra star because I just discovered they're on http://eat24hours.com !
Now I don't even have to battle with my crappy cellphone signal and hilarious misunderstandings of my accent (one time I ordered 'black olives' as a topping once and got... 'brocolli') to get the best pizza in SF!

Gonna be enjoying my delicious moments in 45-60 minutes and I hardly had to lift a finger. *heart symbol* u Deja Vu.
author: Annie C.

description:
Mmmmhmm leftover pizza for lunch at work.

I must say, for delivery in the 'stro, Haight and Mission area, these guys hit the spot. Usually takes about 45 minutes to get a pie delivered, but sometimes, they can surprise you and take less than that. Prices are fair and overall have enjoyed the ability to make combos. Not to compare with big competitor Little Star right around the corner that doesn't deliver and requires insane wait times, but can safely say this is a good, quick alternative.

But PLEASE upload your damn menu to Yelp! It's hard to order when you don't have a menu handy the first few times and it seems a lot of your traffic is coming to you via Yelp - only makes sense, right?
author: Alita M.

description: Waiting two hours for a pizza is unheard of...  When it came the pizza was cold not even tasty at that. I called every 30mins and they kept telling me it's on the way. I've been on yelp a lot and I never wrote a review but this got me so aggravated that I created an acct just to complain. #neveragain #dontknowhowtheyarestillinbuisneas
author: Kristine O.

description:
Second time ordering from this place and thought to write a review! I am eating a slice as I type this actually lol.

Ordered an extra large pepperoni with anchovies on the side for my roommate and I..Put in my order online using delivery.com and just 15 minutes later,bam, they were already at our doorstep. (That has to be a record for the fastest delivery ever in my entire life of ordering pizzas for over  the past decade or so. I don't think a pizza's ever gotten to my house that quick ever.)

So far so good! Pizza is tasting great, hot and fresh...someone complained about this being too salty,not to me this is perfect albeit a tad bit greasy though,but still really hitting the spot atm. No way is Round Table or any of the crappy mainstream ones better! Tastes better than the first time I ordered too which wasn't bad also. Also I really trust their health score on here which is decent compared to other spots. Yes I always check the healthscore here and look for several things(1.If they wash their hands properly AND 2. If they have don't have a rodent/bug problem..If a place breaks either of those rules I stay away...)..So far they've been cool with that. Pizza tonight is tasting great and believe me I am super picky when it comes to pizza spots.... Crust and sauce is hitting my taste pallets in an excellent way atm, good consistency. A little greasy but I don't mind the grease cos it makes me think of how pizzas were made in the 80's! Sauce? Prolly not the greatest pizza sauce I've ever tasted(that award goes to the old Shakey's Pizza in Daly City for best pizza sauce)but it's decent.

I am now a fan and i will order again. Also I love their pizza boxes the pizzas come in because on the artwork it says my name on one of the tomato cans! lol

Edit: Last time I ordered from here,pizza tasted mediocre(sauce was bland!). So I lower the rating to 3 stars.
author: Isabella A.

description:
Now wonder it's called Déjà Vu, I feel like I've had this pizza at every other mediocre slice place in San Francisco.  It's not as disappointing as some of those touristy joints in Union Square, but it's not a place to go out of your way for.  Also, it's weird that they cut their slices into two pieces instead of giving you one large slice.

Cheese: Standard.  Could have had a crisper bottom, but wasn't so limp that it went vertical.

Clam Bake: Always appreciate when a place tries to make clam pizza.  The onions were a little unnecessary, adding a texture and flavor that clashes with the clams and garlic.

Valencia: The eggplant was in that weird state where it wasn't raw, but not cooked to the point of Mediterranean roasted yummyness.  Usually not a fan of veggie focused slices so this reinforced that sentiment.

Porto: Only got this because of the linguiça, a Portuguese alternative that is way better than pepperoni.  It was very middling because the sausage itself wasn't that flavorful and they didn't cook it to the point of being slightly charred.
author: Adam B.

description:
Sometimes you have to accept the nature of things and figure out a plan to adapt.  So it is Friday night and I have been far too aggressive during the last forty five minutes of Happy Hour at a Castro watering hole.  I coast this feeling until around 11.  As I begin to amble my way back to BART, I am craving something cheesy and warm. 

And that's when evolution set in.  I whipped out my phone, found Deja Vu's number, and ordered a slice of cheese for pick up.  Yes, I ordered a slice of cheese for pick up.  I knew it would take ten minutes, which is conveniently how long it was going to take me to walk my little booty to Deja Vu's doorstep.  And like magic, I arrived, handed over my three dollars and there was my mammoth slice waiting all fresh and piping hot.

Do I wish that their slices were more immediate?  Yes.  Am I willing to evolve for the best, most inexpensive and largest slice of pizza in the Mission? Can I get a hell yes!
author: Jeremy G.

description:
IT'S NOT A DEJA VU you wanna remember or experience.  IT'S NOT WORTH THE AGGRAVATION. THE WORST SERVICE EVER and employees are extremely RUDE AND DISHONEST!  
3 for 3 well in excess of an hour and having to refuse the food. The order takers LIE to you when you check on your food as to where it is?
They are consistent  in only one thing, telling  you, "THEY BE RIGHT THERE" and then hanging up on you. NiCE touch..."don't you need my address, or is this how you treat all your customers?"
BEWARE THEY WILL LEAVE YOU HIGH AND DRY AND WITHOUT DINNER.  THEY SUCK!!!  NEVER AGAIN!
author: M G.

description:
For a pizza by the slice place, it's above average for sure. They also have pastas, but I can only vouch for the pizza. 

Few notes:
+ they take credit card, including Discover
+ slices are made to order which is pretty rare to see
author: Captain B.

description:
meh.  too many good options nearby to make a stop here.  
You'll probably like it if you frequently order chicken parm and baked ziti.  the menu is a little dated, like 1980's mom and pop restaurant, or olive garden, unfortunately.  Sorry to be so harsh.
author: Christian W.

description:
I'm convinced you will not find better pizza. Anywhere. Since moving out of San Francisco I've lived in Chicago and New York, both known for their pizza, and still this is the pizza I dream of. 

Although I only get back to SF every few years, I make sure to get Deja Vu pizza every single time I'm back there. It's that good. The combination of impressively fresh toppings, the fact that every "slice" is made to order, the three sided (!) perfectly-textured crust and the incredibly nice folks who own the place makes for a pizza experience like no other.
author: Whitney R.

description: The Pizza is great.. every time I go to the city I make a stop here on the way home from the bars. I usually get a slice of cheese and a slice of pepperoni.. It has always been good pizza and good quality.
author: Dan H.

description:
My delivery experience was horrible and the food sucked so i am never ordering from this place again.

I would rather not relive it but this is what happened:
- i ordered online through eat24.com
- they delivered the wrong item
- i called them and the lady was rude and told me that I had to come by to pick up the correct order
- i get there and she sent the delivery guy to deliver the item.

totally over this place.
author: Audrey T.

description: This place is a little bit on the expensive side for a slice of pizza a vegetarian pizza is 8 bucks. But you can get a Hawaiian for 5$ which is not too bad. The slice tho is big. So it's worth it. It's actually pretty good too. The people seem nice. The service is fast too.
author: Jessca G.

description:
Now I'll be the first to admit I don't hate Domino's or Little Ceasar's or national pizza delivery chains (sorry I'm not sorry), but this place is just as cheap and super delicious.  They have tons of topping options and as others have mentioned, you can order by the slice any type of pizza (I can't think of any other place that does this!) and it's quick!  The space itself is kind of grimy and definitely not somewhere you want to go and sit down and enjoy a long, luxurious dinner.  Take out was perfect and I'm sure on late nights, it's a great stop on the way home.  

The crust is crispy and the toppings seem to be pretty good quality.  It was pretty cheezy and a bit greasy, but if that's what you're going for, no harm done.  The cheezy garlic bread was also pretty delicious and super cheap.  Wings were OK, not great.  The pasta dishes looked good too, but it seems like they're claim to fame is pizza.
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
Deja Vu is definitely one of the places I miss about living in SF. I sometimes find myself yearning for a slice of their pepperoni, sausage, mushroom and cheddar cheese pizza and of course a tossed salad with both ranch AND italian dressing. I order this same thing everywhere, but for some reason, DV's just tastes better. I think a lot of it is the sauce. I definitely can taste a fair amount of oregano and I am a fan. 

Anyhoo, if you are in their delivery radius or roaming by and hungry, give em a try. Yum!
author: Stephy S.

description:
Terrible pizza. It was cold. The dough wasn't cooked. It took nearly 2 hours for delivery.
There's a lot of great pizza joints in SF but this is not one of them. Steer clear.
author: Joshua R.

description:
This place does made-to-order slices. Sure, you have to wait several minutes to get your slice, but it's fresh and hasn't been sitting around for a while.

As a former New-Yorker, this place has got great New-York-style pizza. The crust has just the right "chew" to it and the tomato sauce is really flavorful.

Note that this place is a clone (in a good way) of Serrano's Pizza on 21st @ Valencia. Perhaps they have the same owner.
author: Paul L.

description:
Good pizza (3 stars), with many interesting vegetarian options.  Delivery is typically pretty quick (half hour or so), even on weekend nights (5 stars).  We've ordered from them a half dozen times and pizza is always hot and arrives within their stated time window.  Salads are cheap and fresh.
I do like Patxi's and Marcello's pizza better.  But Deja Vu is quicker and cheaper.
author: Kim E.

description: Tried this because of the 4 stars reviews. Mistake! Pizza was salty and pure disappointing. I rather go for Round Table.
author: Happi Y.

description: Favorite pizza shop in sf for a slice. The slices are huge, enough to share with someone. Amazing selection, perfect amount of grease, and awesome staff. Cannot recommend this place enough!
author: Zach M.

description:
The pizza was fine, a small "Greek Deep Dish" for 21 plus tip.  I ordered from Eat24hours.com and it certainly arrived sooner than expected, far sooner than the 45-60 minute estimate in Friday five o'clock traffic.  

  The pizza was tasty enough.  However... I have just got to warn you, fellow yelper, if you are looking for true deep dish pizza, you should look elsewhere (*cough* Little Star! *cough cough*).  There was a notably thicker, sort of folded-over (not cornmeal) crust towards the edges, but the toppings were far and few in between.  

  I mean, parts of the pizza were practically bare; not what you want when you want deep dish. And I still really, really want a deep dish.
author: Pernicious J.

description: I bought a Greek calzone which has onions, pesto sauce, Canadian bacon and feta cheese.  The meal was very large and made to order.  The final product came piping hot.  Cheese oozed out.  It tasted absolutely fresh and delicious.  Everything about it was just right.  I'd go back in an instant.
author: Mike C.

description:
Deja Vu...yes, the name conjures thoughts of a strip club or a raunchy video store, but their pizza sure hits the spot after a night of partying. They're open at 10:30 AM, and they deliver! 

Our combination pizza arrived earlier than we anticipated, and the delivery man was very cordial, telling us that we were his first delivery of 2011. And the pizza was delicious: plentiful toppings and a chewy, dense crust. Lots of carbs. Just what the doctor ordered.
author: Jen L.

description:
This place isn't that bad for delivery pasta. It tastes just like every other place with 'pasta'. Microwaved noodles and a sauce heated up in the oven in a tin container. I had the Chicken Fettucine Alfredo. Good helping of chicken -- not that much pasta though. Sauce was bland but edible. Also ordered some Buffalo Wings. They tasted good but unfortunately they were burned to the bottom of the tin container they came in so I lost half of each wing when I tried to pick them up. 

Delivery was fast (28 minutes) , guy who answered the phone was nice enough, and was medium priced. I may try them again, but will stay away from the Pasta.
author: Billy K.

description:
Great pizza.  Crust is finished golden brown and still chewy, not overdone.  All the ingredients very tasty too.

So inspiring, I wrote my first review!
author: Karl L.

description:
DeJaVu pizza & pasta is one of the best! Their combos are great and flexibility to design your own slice is totally worth the 5-10min wait for a fresh slice! Their not so well-known pastas and salads are awesome as well.

Can you tell I lived real close to DeJaVu before? Now I'm not so close and I sincerely miss it. Not only for the food, but the awesome owners, cooks and even the delivery guys are cool. 

Burmese, Spanish, Portuguese languages flying everywhere to make you some good food. 

Margarita, Hawainna, and DeJaVu are a few of my favorite pizza slices. The cajun pasta and clam bake pastas are awesome too. Oh man I miss DeJaVu. Enjoy it for me people!
author: Jessica L.

description: Great pizzas made to order. Unique toppings. Love the crust thin and crispy!!! One of my new favs!
author: Musetta S.

description: I love their pizza, but they just lost a long-time, loyal customer. I was charged $8.20 for a SLICE of vegetarian pizza because, "it has eight toppings on it." I told her I thought that was crazy, but I would pay because I ordered it. I asked for a side of dressing. She counted back my change to me and then deducted the price for dressing. $9.00 later,  I am no longer a customer. They get two stars only because the pizza is delicious, even if it's priced like diamonds are a topping option.
author: Haley Jo B.

description:
I really wanted good pizza tonight. I decided to try Deja Vu...oye..

The delivery guy took over an hour, and I LIVE AROUND THE CORNER! 

Turns out he went somewhere "far away" first, while my little pizza sat in the back of his car, only to be delivered AFTER his trip abroad. 

Then he comes to my apartment, calls my cell, while I'm on the phone with his "manager" (actual manager was not there), and I run downstairs only to see him pulling away. I tell the manager to tell him to come back and when he does, I ask, "Why the F would you not ring the doorbell? You're a delivery man!" seriously...I'm still shocked by this the morning after. He was like, "I didn't think of it maam". R u kidding? 

Anyways, take the pizza inside, and toppings look good, smells good, salad is nice (however, no bread...which I specifically asked for and they said they didn't have!?!? a pizza/pasta place with no bread? OYE). BUT, when I began to eat the pizza, all these years of questioning what exactly "cardboard crust" is, were over, and I knew exactly what cardboard crust is. It is the hardest, stalest, grossest, most sad and disappointing crust on earth. As a bread LOVER it's hard to find bread I don't like, but this was TRULY unacceptable crust...a real shame. I will never order Deja Vu again. I suggest getting a burrito tonight...and getting pizza in New York.
author: Alisa M.

description: My favorite pizza in the Mission. Simply the best. New York style pie. Supper fresh. Great crust. The one thing is (and maybe im trippin) that the pizza tastes better to me when you order it by the slice then as a whole. The meatballs and the pasta dishes are amazing as well. Also every time ive eatin from here is was a delivery order.
author: Breezy E.

description:
Laying around on the couch last night watching Monsters vs. Aliens, we knew take-out was the only option; there was no way I was getting my tired ass up to move or cook anything. Pizza tickled our fancy but we took it a step further and decided that calzones from Deja Vu were the way to go, an even BETTER option. 

45 minutes later we get a call, our tums growled with excitement as the calzones made their way up the stairs. They're big and ooozing with sauce, cheese and toppings. What was once sleep behind my eyes is now a fiery desire to stuff my face.

They were every bit as tasty as I imagined and were really cheap. I even have leftovers today for lunch!
author: Julia N.

description: The lady working the counter at night forgets orders and makes you wait excessively long. Terrible service, but good food
author: Ben G.

description:
Fantastic pizza made with FRESH ingredients served with a nice curved crust and in with one slice, ample enough to satisfy a big guy like me.

If you want tomatoes, they cut it up for you, if you want spinich, it will be super fresh and they actually have American Bacon as an option...btw, see Cyrus' review below for a great rec on a pizza.

The location is great, right off the 16st Mission BART station, a couple blocks towards Dolores Park; if you know where Elixer is, look across the street.  Its small and hot inside, but pizza is easy to walk with, so grab a slice, head over to Dolores Park this summer and check out the SF Symphony for free.
author: Edibleocea N.

description:
I was a bit disappointed since I kept hearing such great things about this place and I didn't even mind that I had to wait for my made-to-order slice, in fact I really liked that, thinking OoooOh....this is gonna be good.

So, I got my slice, whoa. it was huge. But the flavor was just ehhh. Pizza was kinda limp too. Next time I think I'm just going to walk over to Arinell's for my better slice of pie.
author: Heidi L.

description: Pizza toppings are very good. We had a 1/2 and 1/2 of the San Franciscan and Pesto/Feta. If you're looking for a crust that is on the thinner to thin side this shop features a fairly think crust.
author: urban r.

description: pizza was delicious! &they let me use the restroom which was awesome, i will def. be back for some more .....mmm drooling thinking about it...
author: Ashley K.

description:
Not to sound like an early 90's standup comic, but there is no such thing as bad pizza. And Deja Vu is a perfect example of that. This is a 3.5 star place. Came in here after a couple drinks, and got a made-to-order canadian bacon and pineapple pizza slice. 

The pizza tasted just fine. and I housed it. It was not anywhere near as good as Escape from new york, golden boys or Pizza Orgasmica, but it's a solid effort from a neighborhood pizza shop. It vaguely reminded me of a french bread pizza in the taste, i got a lot of bread/crust taste in each bite. Not bad, I just like it more saucy... But yeah, if I lived in the area I'd find myself thinking, hmm... pizza? Deja Vu sounds good.

I also liked their drink selection. It was much better than the standard row of coke, diet coke, dr pepper in a cooler. I don't actually think the man who vaguely understood my pizza order behind the counter knows what Izze is, but good job by whichever beverage sales guy got that in there.  T
author: Devin K.

description: Went here tonight for first time and the calzones are good.  Got a vegetable one and a meat.  Very tasty.  Easy to order on line and pick up.
author: Craig W.

description: Deja Vu is great for create your own slices (if you have the time to wait quite a while). We ordered for deliver over the weekend and while the pizza and salad was ok, the chicken wings were straight out of a costco/safeway frozen bag. Fatty and tiny.
author: Nicole O.

description:
If it's not 2am when I'm stumbling to Cable Car for a discounted slice from my flirty friend who works behind the counter, I'm going to Deja Vu.

Tis true, you have to wait a while before you can sink your teeth into this hot and bubbly snack. But, it's worth the wait. They don't just have pies lying about waiting for your drunk ass to come in, they make your slice to order. A SLICE TO ORDER?! What? That's craziness you say? Indeed, good sir. Tis craziness. 

I suggest you bring a book, an ipod, or order your slice and high tail it to a liquor store down the way. Because, you shouldn't be complaining about something that's fresh, hot and affordable. Also, the delivery guys kick ass. They are the coolest delivery guys I've met and are always over appreciative of the generous tips I hand them. Always rushing away.

No extra charge for the half pineapple and the half pepperoni. No charge for delivery.

Goddamn, this is some good pie.
author: Illyanna M.

description: Our local late pizza haunt....I love walking home and grabbing a slice. Yes! You can order a slice anytime of day or night! Well, not anytime as they do close but hell....not many places will make you a slice from scratch, so don't complain if you wait a bit. At least your not getting stale left over crusts from hours before. Deserves an extra star for feeding my yelling belly after a night of too many drinks...
author: Shy A.

description: I don't know what to to think of this place but that if my parents ran a pizza joint, it would be something like this one.  Sauce had a lot of oregano.  Pizza slices are made to order.... I don't know.  This place left me confused!
author: Ting B.

description: Decent pizza, but nothing to write home about. High marks for selling pizza by the slice and offering delivery unlike most of the more "destination" type pizza restaurants in the mission.
author: Joe S.

description: Very tasty big slices!  Can't ask for much more. Takes a little while (~10 minutes) to get a slice, but it is well worth the wait for a piping hot meal.
author: Brian S.

description: After coming here 2 times I  have decided. The pizza is okay but the amount of bad customer service I have received is enough to stop going. First time I it took 30 minutes to get a slice of pizza because the cook was on the phone. Second, I waited at the counter for 8 minutes, after finally getting the woman to come to the counter she answers the phone instead of dealing with the customer in front of her.
author: David C.

description: Awesome monster slice of cheese. Great cheese calzone with lots of sauce. Bargain basement prices. No brainer return trips.
author: Benny A.

description:
So we spent the day in Dolores Park and were on our way walking to some India food place when we walked by a guy sitting outside eating a slide of pizza. I noticed how good it looked and convinced my group to walk inside. We looked at the menu and soon after decided to stay. 

We DEFINITELY made the right choice. I ordered The Alamo, but substituted the tomatoes for jalapenos. It was DE-LICIOUS! The slice was fresh, tasty, and HUGE! Everything tasted great and would highly recommend this place, and will absolutely go back, SOON!
author: Brendon N.

description: I'm debating if I should give this place a 4 or 5...I used to live in the mission way too many years ago and wondered if my favorite pizza place was still around...and it is!  Which says something about how good the pizza is.  You can get it by the slice or pie but what's special about the slice is that they take a huge slice of raw dough and make you a slice from scratch!  The crust is thin but not paper thin and has good flavor.  It's a hole in the wall, not a place to take a date, unless you're super hip maybe you could pull it off by saying you know a great hole in the pizza joint, but you'd have to be super hot and cool to pull that one off...
author: Caitlin K.

description: Recently went to order two extra large pizzas and it came out fast.  I have to say that the times I've been there were during lunch and dinner.  I'm not a late night person and I've picked up the pizzas.  I figure if you want it delivered, it might be worth the drive to pick it up.  I ordered the two pizzas on a Sunday late morning and during the time I waited there must have been 12 more orders in a span of 10 minutes.  This little place gets really busy so I don't fault them.
